briefdescription.para: Node identifier for an instance of a DT_DRV_COMPAT compatible.

simplesect.para: a node identifier for the node with DT_DRV_COMPAT compatible and instance number "inst"

briefdescription.para: Call "fn" on all child nodes of DT_DRV_INST(inst).

detaileddescription.para: The macro "fn" should take one argument, which is the node identifier for the child node.

parameterdescription.para: macro to invoke on each child node identifier

briefdescription.para: Call "fn" on all child nodes of DT_DRV_INST(inst).

detaileddescription.para: The macro "fn" takes multiple arguments. The first should be the node identifier for the child node. The remaining are passed-in by the caller.

parameterdescription.para: macro to invoke on each child node identifier
variable number of arguments to pass to fn

briefdescription.para: Get a DT_DRV_COMPAT value's index into its enumeration values.

simplesect.para: zero-based index of the property's value in its enum: list

briefdescription.para: Like DT_INST_ENUM_IDX(), but with a fallback to a default enum index.

parameterdescription.para: a fallback index value to expand to

simplesect.para: zero-based index of the property's value in its enum if present, default_idx_value ohterwise

briefdescription.para: Get a DT_DRV_COMPAT instance property.

simplesect.para: a representation of the property's value

briefdescription.para: Get a DT_DRV_COMPAT property length.

simplesect.para: logical length of the property

briefdescription.para: Is index "idx" valid for an array type property on a DT_DRV_COMPAT instance?

simplesect.para: 1 if "idx" is a valid index into the given property, 0 otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Get a DT_DRV_COMPAT element value in an array property.

simplesect.para: a representation of the idx-th element of the property

briefdescription.para: Like DT_INST_PROP(), but with a fallback to default_value.

parameterdescription.para: a fallback value to expand to

simplesect.para: DT_INST_PROP(inst, prop) or default_value

briefdescription.para: Get a DT_DRV_COMPAT instance's "label" property.

simplesect.para: instance's label property value

briefdescription.para: Get a DT_DRV_COMPAT instance's property value from a phandle's node.

parameterdescription.para: lowercase-and-underscores property of the phandle's node

simplesect.para: the value of "prop" as described in the DT_PROP() documentation

briefdescription.para: Get a DT_DRV_COMPAT instance's property value from a phandle in a property.

parameterdescription.para: logical index into "phs", which must be zero if "phs" has type "phandle"
lowercase-and-underscores property of the phandle's node

simplesect.para: the value of "prop" as described in the DT_PROP() documentation

briefdescription.para: Get a DT_DRV_COMPAT instance's phandle-array specifier value at an index.

parameterdescription.para: binding's cell name within the specifier at index "idx"

simplesect.para: the value of the cell inside the specifier at index "idx"

briefdescription.para: Like DT_INST_PHA_BY_IDX(), but with a fallback to default_value.

parameterdescription.para: binding's cell name within the specifier at index "idx"
a fallback value to expand to

simplesect.para: DT_INST_PHA_BY_IDX(inst, pha, idx, cell) or default_value

briefdescription.para: Get a DT_DRV_COMPAT instance's phandle-array specifier value Equivalent to DT_INST_PHA_BY_IDX(inst, pha, 0, cell)

parameterdescription.para: binding's cell name for the specifier at "pha" index 0

simplesect.para: the cell value

briefdescription.para: Like DT_INST_PHA(), but with a fallback to default_value.

parameterdescription.para: binding's cell name for the specifier at "pha" index 0
a fallback value to expand to

simplesect.para: DT_INST_PHA(inst, pha, cell) or default_value

briefdescription.para: Get a DT_DRV_COMPAT instance's value within a phandle-array specifier by name.

parameterdescription.para: lowercase-and-underscores name of a specifier in "pha"
binding's cell name for the named specifier

simplesect.para: the cell value

briefdescription.para: Like DT_INST_PHA_BY_NAME(), but with a fallback to default_value.

parameterdescription.para: lowercase-and-underscores name of a specifier in "pha"
binding's cell name for the named specifier
a fallback value to expand to

simplesect.para: DT_INST_PHA_BY_NAME(inst, pha, name, cell) or default_value

briefdescription.para: Get a DT_DRV_COMPAT instance's phandle node identifier from a phandle array by name.

parameterdescription.para: lowercase-and-underscores name of an element in "pha"

simplesect.para: node identifier for the phandle at the element named "name"

briefdescription.para: Get a DT_DRV_COMPAT instance's node identifier for a phandle in a property.

parameterdescription.para: lowercase-and-underscores property name in "inst" with type "phandle", "phandles" or "phandle-array"

simplesect.para: a node identifier for the phandle at index "idx" in "prop"

briefdescription.para: Get a DT_DRV_COMPAT instance's node identifier for a phandle property's value.

simplesect.para: a node identifier for the node pointed to by "ph"

briefdescription.para: is "idx" a valid register block index on a DT_DRV_COMPAT instance?

simplesect.para: 1 if "idx" is a valid register block index, 0 otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Get a DT_DRV_COMPAT instance's idx-th register block's address.

parameterdescription.para: index of the register whose address to return

simplesect.para: address of the instance's idx-th register block

briefdescription.para: Get a DT_DRV_COMPAT instance's idx-th register block's size.

parameterdescription.para: index of the register whose size to return

simplesect.para: size of the instance's idx-th register block

briefdescription.para: Get a DT_DRV_COMPAT's register block address by name.

simplesect.para: address of the register block with the given name

briefdescription.para: Get a DT_DRV_COMPAT's register block size by name.

simplesect.para: size of the register block with the given name

briefdescription.para: Get a DT_DRV_COMPAT's (only) register block address.

simplesect.para: instance's register block address

briefdescription.para: Get a DT_DRV_COMPAT's (only) register block size.

simplesect.para: instance's register block size

briefdescription.para: Get a DT_DRV_COMPAT interrupt specifier value at an index.

parameterdescription.para: logical index into the interrupt specifier array

simplesect.para: the named value at the specifier given by the index

briefdescription.para: Get a DT_DRV_COMPAT interrupt specifier value by name.

simplesect.para: the named value at the specifier given by the index

briefdescription.para: Get a DT_DRV_COMPAT interrupt specifier's value.

simplesect.para: the named value at that index

briefdescription.para: Get a DT_DRV_COMPAT's (only) irq number.

simplesect.para: the interrupt number for the node's only interrupt

briefdescription.para: Get a DT_DRV_COMPAT's bus node identifier.

simplesect.para: node identifier for the instance's bus node

briefdescription.para: Get a DT_DRV_COMPAT's bus node's label property.

simplesect.para: the label property of the instance's bus controller

briefdescription.para: Test if a DT_DRV_COMPAT's bus type is a given type.

parameterdescription.para: a binding's bus type as a C token, lowercased and without quotes

simplesect.para: 1 if the given instance is on a bus of the given type, 0 otherwise

briefdescription.para: Test if any DT_DRV_COMPAT node is on a bus of a given type and has status okay.

detaileddescription.para: This is a special-purpose macro which can be useful when writing drivers for devices which can appear on multiple buses. One example is a sensor device which may be wired on an I2C or SPI bus.

briefdescription.para: Call "fn" on all nodes with compatible DT_DRV_COMPAT and status "okay".

detaileddescription.para: This macro calls "fn(inst)" on each "inst" number that refers to a node with status "okay". Whitespace is added between invocations.
Note that "fn" is responsible for adding commas, semicolons, or other separators or terminators.
Device drivers should use this macro whenever possible to instantiate a struct device for each enabled node in the devicetree of the driver's compatible DT_DRV_COMPAT.

parameterdescription.para: Macro to call for each enabled node. Must accept an instance number as its only parameter.

briefdescription.para: Call "fn" on all nodes with compatible DT_DRV_COMPAT and status "okay" with multiple arguments.

parameterdescription.para: Macro to call for each enabled node. Must accept an instance number as its only parameter.
variable number of arguments to pass to fn

briefdescription.para: Invokes "fn" for each element of property "prop" for a DT_DRV_COMPAT instance.
Invokes "fn" for each element of property "prop" for a DT_DRV_COMPAT instance with multiple arguments.

parameterdescription.para: variable number of arguments to pass to fn

briefdescription.para: Does a DT_DRV_COMPAT instance have a property?

simplesect.para: 1 if the instance has the property, 0 otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Does a phandle array have a named cell specifier at an index for a DT_DRV_COMPAT instance?

parameterdescription.para: named cell value whose existence to check

simplesect.para: 1 if the named cell exists in the specifier at index idx, 0 otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Does a phandle array have a named cell specifier at index 0 for a DT_DRV_COMPAT instance?

parameterdescription.para: named cell value whose existence to check

simplesect.para: 1 if the named cell exists in the specifier at index 0, 0 otherwise.

briefdescription.para: is index valid for interrupt property on a DT_DRV_COMPAT instance?

parameterdescription.para: logical index into the interrupt specifier array

simplesect.para: 1 if the idx is valid for the interrupt property 0 otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Does a DT_DRV_COMPAT instance have an interrupt named cell specifier?

parameterdescription.para: named cell value whose existence to check

simplesect.para: 1 if the named cell exists in the interrupt specifier at index idx 0 otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Does a DT_DRV_COMPAT instance have an interrupt value?

parameterdescription.para: named cell value whose existence to check

simplesect.para: 1 if the named cell exists in the interrupt specifier at index 0 0 otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Does a DT_DRV_COMPAT instance have an interrupt value?

simplesect.para: 1 if "name" is a valid named specifier
